key_events.description: Physical vacancy increased to 2.4% at the end of November 2025 and is projected to reach 4.5% by the end of February 2026.

Multiple tenants exited properties, including Roja and Eletrobras (Syslog), Memodoc (Duque de Caxias), Plastic Omnium (São José), with Êxito (Syslog), TLS (CLE), and RV Imola (Ribeirão Preto) expected to exit in January and February 2026.
Knight Therapeutics to enter Masterlabs in December 2025.
R$ 1.10 per share dividend has been consistently paid for the last 30 months, with the next dividend also at R$1.1, ex-date February 03, 2026.
Property revaluation showed an average increase of 2.52% compared to the accounting values of December 2024.

investment_thesis.bull_case: Consistent dividend payments of R$1.10 per share and property revaluation increase of 2.52% suggest stability and potential growth.
investment_thesis.bear_case: Rising vacancy rates, projected to reach 4.5% by February 2026, and multiple tenant exits pose a risk to income and portfolio stability.

summary_markdown: HGLG11 faces increasing vacancy, rising to 2.4% in November 2025 and projected to 4.5% by February 2026. Tenant exits include Roja, Eletrobras (Syslog), Memodoc (Duque de Caxias), and Plastic Omnium (São José), with further exits expected in January and February 2026. Knight Therapeutics will enter Masterlabs in December 2025. The fund has consistently paid R$1.10 per share in dividends for 30 months, with the next dividend at the same value (ex-date February 03, 2026). Property revaluation showed a 2.52% increase compared to December 2024 values.
